m_q.target_metric: Mean geopotential energy per unit mass (J/kg) for Swarm-A satellite from September 2-29, 2019
sub_questions: Where are the SP3 files containing Swarm-A orbital data for September 2-29, 2019?
How to extract geodetic position (latitude, longitude, altitude) from SP3 files?
How to define the mock geopotential field using lat_grid, lon_grid, alt_grid?
What is the geopotential function to interpolate from the grid?
How to convert satellite positions to match grid coordinate system?
How to compute geopotential energy per unit mass at each timepoint?
How to average the energy values across all timepoints in the period?

sources: SP3 files (not provided, required for Swarm-A precise orbital data)
schema_conflicts: SP3 files not present in provided data - only grid definition available
Missing geopotential values - only grid coordinates provided

unit_annotations.alt_grid: km (assumed based on earth radius context)

scale_issues: Altitude in grid appears to be in km, needs conversion to meters for energy calculation
Earth radius given in km (6371.0), gravitational constant in m/s^2
Need consistent unit system for geopotential energy calculation (SI units: meters, m/s^2)
cross_source_conflicts: SP3 orbital data units (typically in meters or km) must match grid altitude units
Coordinate systems: geodetic (from SP3) vs grid coordinates (lat/lon/alt)

format_notes: NPZ file contains three arrays: lat_grid, lon_grid, alt_grid
Missing geopotential values - only coordinate grids provided
SP3 files are binary format with specific orbital data structure
Sample data shows some missing values in alt_grid column
Grid appears to define sampling points, actual geopotential field values not included

constraints: Date range must be September 2-29, 2019 (28 days)
Output must be rounded to 2 decimal places
derived_filters: Extract only Swarm-A records from SP3 files
Exclude invalid or missing position data points
statistical_tests: Verify mean calculation across all valid timepoints
Check for outliers in computed energy values
